hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Contraction Breakout Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout from a multi-day low-volatility range (as defined by 5-day Average True Range < 50% of its 30-day average) that occurs on below-average volume will fail and revert back into the range 70% of the time.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volatility environments often precede expansion, but breakouts on low volume lack conviction and are frequently traps set by market makers or washed out by mean reversion algos. This is a classic 'false breakout' pattern.
entry_conditions: BTC price breaks above/below the 5-day high/low
Volume on breakout candle is < 20-period average volume
Enter fade (short if breakout high, long if breakout low) on close of breakout candle

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price returns to the midpoint of the prior 5-day range
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 1.5x the 5-day ATR beyond the breakout level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The success rate of the fade (price returning to range midpoint) is below 60%, or the average loss from stop-outs is more than 1.5x the average profit from take-profits.
